We really appreciate Rachel and Dan's overall assistance and guidance on living off grid, as well as their consideration to help us create lifelong memories on their paradise of an off-grid site. Our time together was a gift. Of course also their farmstand treats, and farm tour! We are extremely grateful for all of your efforts in growing food and creating abundance and kindness in the community. Hopefully we can meet again soon! Thank you again.

Very peaceful stay at forest hale. The information book on table was very informative as well as the quick response from host -very responsive. It was truly a therapeutic stay. I look forward into staying again in the future .

This was a highlight of our trip to Hawaii. Dan and Rachel were lovely hosts. Dan took us on a tour around the farm, taught us all about organic farming and chocolate making. Our boys absolutely loved it and will be talking about that cabin for years to come. The waterfall was a bonus! what a gem!
We really enjoyed this jungle oasis. It had everything we needed and was very comfortable.
We had a pleasant time here surrounded by the rainforest. We especially enjoyed the sounds of waterfall, frogs and birds.

This place is a treasure! The drive in through the countryside is so beautiful. The house is nestled behind tropical plants and feels so private and peaceful. Inside is simple, but comfortable. We left the windows open at night to enjoy the sounds of soft rain and coqui frogs. It was also such a neat experience to try the fruit and chocolate from the farm. It was some of the best I’ve ever had!
Incredible location. Unique and peaceful. We loved our time at the farm - we'd love to come back!

Two thumbs up and would highly recommend. This farm stay was exactly what we were looking for. The route to get there was gorgeous. The mornings and evenings were so peaceful. The hosts were helpful and friendly and the farm stand produce was delicious. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
We loved this beautiful and well maintained cottage. This is a gorgeous part of the island. We also loved our farm tour.

Rachel and Dan's place truly felt like a home to us. I only regret we didn't stay longer! My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon. The waterfall is so beautiful, and the carefully laid pathway to it is awesome - they have taken great care to put in perfect stone steps and a railing to guide you down to the waterfall. The home feels very private and boasts the best stocked kitchen of any airbnb (gas stove, metal utensils, cast iron and stainless steel cookware). Take the farm tour and buy some of their unique and carefully crafted chocolate - it was one of the highlights of our trip! The farm stand is great too. The bed is comfy and high quality.
Quiet and peaceful setting. Exactly what we were looking for. Beautiful grounds with an amazing waterfall and swimming hole.
The waterfall was very pretty, and the fruit and chocolate baskets were fun.
Great place, and the breakfast basket was definitely worth it
As described with some fun things nearby. Enjoyed the waterfall and the make it yourself breakfast offerings.

We had a very pleasant time in Rachel and Dan’s cabin.
The environment is perfect for resting and escaping, in the open country of Big Island.

What a great place to have a genuine Hawaiian stay. Including the most magnificent waterfall imaginable right out the back door. Rachel and Dan are the most genuine lovable people you will ever meet, and you can taste that love “Aloha” in every chocolate bar they produce and everything they do around this beautiful permaculture farm. If its available book now. They need to raise the price. Mahalo.
Cannot express how beautiful this place is.... It's a perfect stay

Rachel was an awesome host! We throughly enjoyed our time and hope to stay here again in the next year. A delightful breakfast basket and the coffee and tea were amazing!
Thank you, Rachel. You made this whole trip even better than it already was. The beach gear was a surprise and we really took advantage of it! What a beautiful property and we highly recommend the breakfast basket!
There are some playing cards and other games on property and we had some great connective family time swimming at the waterfall and at the kitchen table playing games. It was a delight through and through.
We really enjoyed our stay at the farm. Exactly what we were looking for.
This was a great place! We loved how secluded and private it was, and the waterfall was amazing! Great fresh eggs and fruit as well, and we are big fans of the chocolate from the farm stand!

Beautiful surroundings and waterfall on an awesome organic self sustaining farm. Rachel and Dan are very kind and welcoming. Loved the organic fruit and goods available for purchase at the on sight stand. The DIY breakfast basket and cacao tour offered as an extra are highly recommended.

Rachel's place is one of the most unique and beautiful places I've stayed at. It is relatively secluded on a farm, surrounded by nature, but doesn't feel "remote". The bedroom is very comfortable and the kitchen is well-stocked (we got fresh eggs, chocolate, and fruit from Rachel). It rained one night while we were there, but the sky was clear the next day and the view of the stars was almost as clear as from the top of Mauna Kea.
The location is close enough to places we wanted to visit (about 30 minutes to Hilo and restaurants, about 1.5 hours to Mauna Kea, about 1 hour to Volcanoes National Park) so it was perfect. We'd love to stay here again when we visit the Big Island again!
My family enjoyed the stay at Rachel’s cozy cabin, which brought back fond memories of my childhood. The natural beauty and sounds of the farm have been a refreshing change of pace.
Rachel’s place is an hidden gem.. don’t miss it.. go for it…Kulike waterfalls is a huge bonus.. due to rains, we couldn’t enjoy as much but next time🙏

3 miles off the main highway, the location is peaceful and quiet. (With lots of coqui frogs at night!) Sadly, it was a bit too cool to try the private waterfall/pool but it sure looked inviting!
The cottage is cozy, clean, and simply appointed.
Try Rachel's delicious DIY Breakfast basket! Eggs and a variety of fruits from their forest farm. And treat yourself to farm-made chocolate bars from their farm stand! Delicious and made under the best conditions.
We didn't get a chance to book a farm tour but it is on our list for when we return.
Loved the farm! We got a fruit basket, and it was amazing! The space was so peaceful, surrounded by nature. Must checkout the waterfall! Amazing stay, would stay again.

This was a stunning little cottage that exceeded all of our expectations. The cottage is in a more remote area, but believe me when I say it is incredibly plush. Do not be afraid that it is partially off grid; the gas stove and propane heater ensure you can cook all your food and take a (reasonable; don’t be wasteful!) hot shower. The location is unparalleled and the local fauna and onsite waterfall were magical. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting outside each morning and admiring the plants. The frogs were nice white noise at night, too. I would also encourage guests to enjoy the optional fruit + egg basket and to purchase the local chocolate from the farm stand. Altogether, we had a delightful stay and would thoroughly recommend this place to other prospective guests.
Rachel’s place is in a beautiful location with a private waterfall. Make sure to opt in for her delicious eggs, fruit and chocolate baskets. A real unique experience!

This farmstay is an amazing spot. The walk down the road at sunrise was one of the highlights of the stay--the ocean appears over the horizon as you walk down the road. The water at the waterfall was quite cold, so we only went swimming once, but it is beautiful. We appreciated learning from Dan on the farm tour, and we couldn't get enough of the honey-sweetened chocolate they make and sell at the farm stand!
Rachel went above and beyond by mailing us the brush that my daughter left behind when we checked out.

We originally were staying at a Hilton resort which immediately after checking in we realized that it was not the way we wanted to spend our time on the big island. We cancelled the rest of our stay and found Rachel’s place after a last minute cancellation that they had. We came to the place late at night and Rachel was responsive in making sure we made it! We loved the place, the farm stand, waterfall, breakfast basket and chocolate basket that we were able to purchase from the farm. The obvious pro to this place is the location you are in the middle of the jungle but that is also the only negative you are in the middle of the jungle. Expect bugs, moths and loud frogs. While we never saw a frog we sure heard them at night! My partner found it peaceful, I put in some earplugs. We loved relaxing on the porch and walking around the property looking at all the vegetation. If you can handle a little bugs and frogs and this place is available, do it, it’s 1000% worth it! Thank you!!

This home and farm are beautiful. Spacious, fully stocked with everything we could have needed, and very very clean. The waterfall was such a treat. The farm stand has lots of delicious and hand crafted items. Our only regret was that we didn’t book a longer trip! The hosts were really sweet and the farm tour was very cool! I would recommend this place if you wanted a more laid back experience.
Beautiful and peaceful place, exactly as advertised. Waterfal was so special, owners were responsive and helpful. cabin is off grid, but has wifi. it was a nice escape!

The Forest Hale cabin and farm was even more fantastic than the pictures! What a stunning, peaceful and secluded spot. I was expecting the cabin to be like “glamping” but it’s way closer to a standard hotel suite— just on top of nature. Rachel was a fantastic host and the tour of the farm was very informative. She was very welcoming. Everything we ate from the farm was incredible. I can’t imagine getting to know Hawaii any other way. We’d go back in a heartbeat!

WOW!! I cannot even begin to explain how magical our stay was! Falling asleep to the sounds of coqui frogs, walking around the gorgeous grounds and spotting geckos and various fruit trees was so fun! We purchased some goodies from the farm stand and enjoyed farm fresh eggs and the best chocolate I've ever had! The highlight was the private waterfall/swimming hole! The water was chilly but absolutely worth getting soaked under the eaterfall. Our swim was pure magic--peaceful, private, and we even spotted prawns! If you are looking for a relaxing, gorgeous stay that highlights Hawaii's natural beauty, this is it! I've already recommended this stay to family and friends. We would definitely come back!

One of my favorite airbnbs I’ve stayed at so far. The house was great. It was remote and off grid but so cool! I loved the private waterfall most of all! Being able to buy fruit and chocolate was nice too. The house was clean and the host was very responsive. Would definitely stay again.

Very lovely and private jungle setting. The road in was just as lovey. The water fall really is just 3min walk from the front door but it rains so frequently that we didn’t find the water too inviting (murky).
The place was clean and lots of thoughtful items included to make the stay comfortable. Lots of items available in the kitchen to use, more than what we needed to cook. Our hot water/propane gave us hot water the entire stay. Everything was well cared for and maintained. The host was very responsive and checked in on us to make sure we arrive ok.
The only down side: mosquitoes were more abundant than expected - but that should have been expected.
All in all - incredible.

This was the most beautiful place I have ever been. The place felt right at home and had everything you could possibly need in the kitchen and plenty of towels. The drive up there was so beautiful from Hilo and the waterfall absolutely took your breath away. And the farm stand was an absolute plus! We are from Oahu and will definitely be back. Thanks so much again!

We had a lovely stay! The singing of the frogs at night rocked us, the environment is very relaxing. Despite our late request Rachel was able to provide us with a great breakfast basket 😊 All good! Thanks again!

This is a country loving bnb! The waterfall was an amazing little feature to have. Keep in mind, steep and slippery steps down to get to it. From the house, you can hear the falls pumping and it adds to the already peaceful surroundings. The basics were provided in the home. They even had a pack n play for our littlest traveler. Hawaii living at its finest with provided rules for recycling and composting. Be prepared for sorting! The fruit flies are ever present with the abundance of fruit just outside your door but the hosts were prepared with all needed items to combat them indoor and out. Great atractions nearby for everyone in the family. Overall, I would stay here again and stay longer! A firepit or fire feature could be a good addition for the home if the owners were open to suggestions. Loved our stay!
If you're a fan of nature this is the place to be. Highly recommendable and great host.

A beautiful part of Hawaii, felt like we were escaping the tourist bustle. Quiet, secluded, very private in amongst lush gardens. Highly recommend the fruit & egg basket, which Rachel thoughtfully put together from their farm! We LOVED the sounds of the frogs and forest at night - beats city sounds any time ;) Thank you for a fabulous experience.
I had a relaxing few says at the Forest Hale and would highly recommend it! Unfortunately, I had to cut my trip to the BI short, but I will definitely be back to stay!

Absolutely stunning place. Our favorite place during our 9 day stay on the Big Island. Spoke with Rachel a few times and had a great time. Truly breathtaking experience. My husband loved the chocolate that they sell in their fruit farm stand. 10/10. Gets your away from the crowds and people. Ultimate getaway experience. Thank you for letting us stay.

Rachel’s place was fantastic for our family stay. The waterfall and swimming hole were delightful for us and the kids…just the path through the bamboo forest to the waterfall was an adventure for us! The farm itself is so peaceful. It wasn’t far to Hilo, and we spent a lot of time there, at farmers market, Carlsmith beach, and the many good restaurants in town. We find ourselves coming to the Hamakua coast again and again, and our stay at Rachel’s convinced us that we will be back soon.
Amazing spot on earth, bless Rachel and her husband for creating this farm and sharing it with the rest of us! Only wish I had not had an emergency that cut my stay in half, but I'll be back!

A very homey and welcoming cabin in the food forest. The cabin had a bedroom, and separate sleeping accomodations for kids in the loft above. Loft looks down into the living room / kitchen area. Washer and dryer were very handy when staying for over a week. Not only did the hosts provide helpful pointers, but they also had equipment (e.g. boogie boards, towels, etc) one could borrow for the beach.
Hosts were super responsive. Any time we had a question or needed something, they replied promptly and helped.
The farm stand had delicious fresh produce (fresh local fruit and veg is the best!) and chocolate. The stand was conveniently located on the way in. They also provided eggs and sugar cane lemonade at a stand up the hill a bit.
We opted for both the farm and chocolate tours. They both were fascinating! We learned a lot about this place, food forests, and how chocolate is made.

Rachel is great. like the experience we had to sleep at her place. my 21-year-old son felt very good. we had never slept in such a place. if I could, I'll put 6 stars. yet I'm afraid of insects. but everything is good. the waterfall is very beautiful but I haven't been there, too many mosquitoes. thank you again, we loved your cottage. very well equipped in addition. thank you

Beautiful little home with peaceful surroundings. Lake, trees with fruits , plants all around the home , ducks , smell of pure air is just mesmerizing. One should be lucky to own or stay in a home like this. My 6 years old daughter experienced this for the first time and she is so so happy. I am glad that I chose this place to stay. Rachel, thank you so much for letting us stay here. Not forgetting, the cookies and chocolates on the farm stand are so delicious.

Such a treat to stay here. So thankful for there to be Airbnb’s such as this. Easy to feel right at home here. The hale itself has everything you need-and is very well kept and clean. The surrounding property and area is simply beautiful.
I had been to the property another time before, but was not staying the night. This time around booked for two nights as I had my folks visiting. An absolute gem this place-look forward to returning!

Great little cottage in the middle of incredibly green. For 2 adults and 2 children well enough. Well maintained bathroom. Kitchen with more equipment than you need for a few days. Breakfast basket with cacao fruit, soursop, papaya, apple bananas, some herbs and eggs was a blast. An ideal hideaway for a few days of relaxation in the rainforest. By the way, the frogs are noisy, part of a wonderful nature and not disturbing at all. We loved them.
Authentic and fun experience. Loved our stay there.

The place as described in the details with lush surroundings, peaceful, and off the beaten path.  The DIY breakfast basket was a nice touch. There aren't any eateries nearby so plan ahead.  Host was very responsive.  Nice place to stay for a night or two.

We stayed here for two nights and would love to come back. The farm is beautiful and it was so much fun to swim under the waterfall. We saw several cute geckos and even one frog. The kitchen and bathroom had everything we needed. We loved the stunning views and the farm stand.

I considered not reviewing this Airbnb. I want to keep it a secret. It’s not in a resort area. It’s off grid, and I love that. Let’s just say it’s authentic, special, one of a kind. Rachel and Dan were the best Airbnb hosts I have ever had. I am just praying this place will stay available for years to come as I play on staying again asap. Thank you so much for the gorgeous fruit basket, chocolate, sugar cane lemonade. Thank you Dan for the amazing tour!

This was our families ( husband and 2 teenagers) favorite place we stayed on our trip .. they loved the waterfall, the night time frogs, the sounds and the feeling of being in such a beautiful secluded tropical place with the fruit stand and breakfast baskets giving us new and interesting fruits to experience. We used one of the 10 percent off coupons in the cabin to do book the Botanical Gardens zip lines and Gardens which are basically on the property and this gave us a great glimpse of the surrounding land and a feeling of how special this place is. Book zipline ahead and just tell them you have the coupon.. We booked after we arrived but the time slots where limited. We stayed two nights... we could have stayed longer.. great location to Hilo and Waimea. Make sure you do the nearby scenic drive to explore other rivers coming down the valley. Thank you Rachel for sharing your beautiful space with us it was magical.

We stayed in 3 different places on our trip around the Big Island. This was our favorite spot. It was the perfect place to wind down and relax at the end of our trip. Rachel was the perfect hostess. Thank you!

Amazing stay! Really nice off the grid place. Middle of nature and it’s beauty. Rachel and Dan were amazing people to meet during the farm tour. Highly recommend. Also, you get used to the nature sounds, no worries.
The most beautiful place I’ve ever stayed! I swam in the waterfall every morning! Rachel responded very quickly to all my inquiries and was very welcoming and kind.

The cottage in the rainforest was exactly what we needed to get away from it all. Everything was very clean. Rachel included little extras that made our stay so convenient such as thermoses for coffee to go and umbrellas. The frogs are very loud at night but the fan that was included allowed us to sleep peacefully. The farm store was so much fun and allowed me to indulge in special treats right from the farm during our stay. We opted to do the farm tour with Dan and learned about regenerative farming and the fruits grown on property. Thank you Rachel for being such a responsive host and we hope to return again one day!

A special experience in the jungle of Hawaii.
You can't miss a small waterfall nearby. I rested comfortably thanks to the friendly host.

This experience was more than we expected. if you're looking to truly unwind and get away from the crowds and lights of the city. Enjoy this open land ranch experience 3 miles from the highway tucked deep in the forest. we could not have asked for a better place to spend our week in Hilo. From the market stand on the private driveway, shared lagoon and waterfall. to all the suggestions and information for traveling and activities our time was perfect. we never needed anything, and our host was available and responsive if needed. We highly recommend staying at the farm.

Based on where the place is located is enough to speak highly of. Remote, very quiet. Fresh fruit, fresh eggs and mountain water. We loved the tour of the farm, too. We can't forget to mention the freshly made chocolate! The waterfall on premise was a huge bonus!

This was by far my favorite place we stayed in Hawaii! I prefer quiet, rural, farm like settings with wilderness around in this was exactly it. Furthermore, there was every tropical fruit you could imagine, including cacao, which I have always wanted to taste fresh pods from a plant, and this was probably the best possible place that I could’ve ever found for that! I also learned some new things about keeping chickens, as I have my own chickens and gain some new ideas from Dan on how to improve my set up where I live, which is also rural, but much colder! The cabin was wonderful: it was bright, clean, lovely breeze, and lovely view, and just a short distance to a wonderful waterfall that you could swim in. I just can’t say enough about how much I love this place! Thank you Rachel and thank you Dan for such a wonderful time I wish I could’ve spent my entire vacation there!

One of the most unique and beautiful locations we have stayed in Big Island. Conveniently located between Akaka falls and Hilo, Rachel & Dan's Kulike farm is beautiful, peaceful and a relaxing getaway. If you are looking for a place to unwind, away from the tourists, and get a flavor of the real Big Island, then this is your spot. The best part of the location was Rachel's amazing fruit basket and the farmstand - allowing us to enjoy the local flavors. We look forward to our future stay at Kulike farm.

Rachel’s farm was beautiful. The house was perfect, clean and simple, loved the sound of the rain on the roof. The waterfall on the property is a truly special place, magical!!! Highly recommend the farm tour and say yes to the farm fresh eggs and fruit basket in the morning. Choosing this location to explore Hilo and the waterfalls was a perfect choice.

We had a great time at Rachel’s. Perfect for unwinding and being closer to nature. The proximity to waterfall and fresh fruit right on the farm was a nice perk. Make sure to say yes to the fruit basket prior to arrival!

Our family of three stayed at the Forest Hale for 4 nights, it was both fantastic and memorable. The property was exactly as posted, and we were so happy we chose to stay here for our vacation. Rachel is a wonderful host; we also went on a farm tour to learn all about the transformation of the area into the gem of an off-grid eco-friendly fruit farm it is today. Very inspiring, a wonderful place to visit! Highly recommend!

Rachel and Dan's regenerative farm is a heavenly place to stay where the surroundings are beautiful and their attractive well maintained cottage provides everything you need for a very comfortable time. The location is ideal for travelers who want to experience the amazing waterfalls and dramatic scenery along the eastern coast of the Big Island as well as have a chance to visit Hilo, the largest city on the island. Rachel and Dan were very friendly hosts. Be sure to enjoy some of the food sold at their farm stand and to sign up for a tour of their farm as well.
We went during the rainy season but the farm was still beautiful.
Lovely place, great host. Nice to be off the grid!

Rachel & Dan’s place is exactly as advertised. It is a very private and well equipped cabin located on a cacao farm. It is quiet and full of light. Yes, there are frogs at night but you will miss them once you go home :-). Despite not being on the property during our stay, Rachel responded quickly to our messages and communicated well. The road in is fine. Hilo and the local beaches are only 25-30 minutes away. Overall, a great base to explore the east coast of the island.

A remote, peaceful place on a working farm… but you’d never know that other than by the sweet farm stand at the entrance. We purchased one of Rachel’s fruit baskets, fun to get an array of foods we’d never tried before. Cabin is well appointed, particularly the kitchen. We cooked during our stay and found everything we needed. Bed was very comfortable. Very good WiFi connection. We took advantage of free passes for the nearby botanical gardens, was fun to walk down and explore those.

Beautiful location off the beaten path and very private. Great value and plenty of room for our family of 4 (kids loved the loft). So fun to use the self serve farm stand. We all enjoyed the farm tour and learning about different tropical fruit (that wouldn’t even grow in a greenhouse where we live). We purchased a fruit basket from Rachel and we all tasted fruit we had never even heard of before. So fun. Excellent introduction to permaculture in Hawaii. Oh and they have a beautiful private waterfall that is about a min walk away.
Love this place so much. A little hard to find, but we finally made it. Definitely will come back!! The surroundings area so amazing. Super comfortable bed!!!

What a unique and lovely place! So peaceful and located near some beautiful sights just outside of Hilo.
The house was comfortable and clean and just what our party of 3 adults needed.
The farm itself is so interesting
and shows what hardworking people Rachel and Dan are. We really enjoyed meeting them and even some of the rest of their family! I hope we get to go back some day and would highly recommend it to anyone that wants to stay in a safe, quiet place while visiting Hilo area.
it was exactly as advertised and the waterfall was so beautiful. about 30 minutes to Hilo. Not as remote as I had thought. the breakfast basket was so good. I'd stay here again
Rachel was incredibly responsive and helpful. The stars at night and farm are stunning. Great experience away from Hill city centre

Super comfy and peaceful. Very jungly and quiet. So nice and restful. If you’re looking for a peaceful home base I don’t think you can do much better than this. Loved the kitchen and the big windows and the silence.
This place was so serene and the location was beautiful. It feels like a dream come true! A private waterfall and a farm stand was one of the highlights. The host was so accommodating in every way!

We loved our stay here! The surroundings were absolutely beautiful and so unique. It was 100% worth the 30min drive to Hilo for day activities and meals. As it is mentioned in the description, a suv would be best to access their property. The kitchen is fully equipped, we made several meals during our stay, and the coffee that is provided is wonderful! I highly recommend the fruit basket, we were able to try some new fruits we wouldn’t necessarily buy ourselves (our favorite was the Abiu). The waterfall was amazing and the hosts very communicative. We would 100% stay here again.

Where do I even begin? The Forest Hale is a lovely retreat and also an unique experience that is the highlight of our stay on Big Island. Highly recommended. Rachel is a terrific host who made sure we had everything we needed to be comfortable. We look forward to being back again.

Our family had such a relaxing vacation at Rachel & Dan’s farm. Our kids miss the farm. When we go back to the Big Island, we want to stay there again. When our family talked about our top two favorite parts of the trip, everyone named Rachel’s farm as one of them. It is truly a special place - a cottage with a loft, a farm with a waterfall, walking paths with fruits, and a farm store that has yummy chocolate Rachel & Dan make.
Rachel was a lovely host and gave our kids their favorite memory of fruit picking. Rachel gave such a detailed description of how to get to the farm. We had no problems at all despite arriving at night. She was also very responsive and checked in with us to see if we were comfortable. We had everything that we needed to feel at home in the cottage.
The location is a short drive to downtown Hilo, Coconut Island beach, Carlsmith beach (yes folks Hilo has beaches), Akaka falls, and the World Botanical Garden & Zip Line is literally at the bottom of the hill.
We had a great stay! Awesome little off grid cottage just north of Hilo
Accurate description that matched what we were looking for. Delicious produce and chocolate!

This place was so wonderful, the waterfall and pool underneath were a real treat! It was also well stocked with lots of extra supplies we didn't even think of and definitely used, like umbrellas and coffee travel mugs. The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. I do think the upstairs was super cute! We did not need it, because it was just two of us, but I think as a teenager I would have loved hanging out in the loft upstairs. It is definitely not stairs for very little kids, but for slightly older ones it feels like a cool hangout. The views outside the living area and bedroom were beautiful, the perfect place to wake up and have a lovely breakfast in the morning. The frogs serenaded us at night and I loved it, but they were loud so if you need silence when you sleep use the ear plugs they provide. Overall it was the most magical stay!
Great place to be secluded. Amazing view and the water full close by was awesome.

If you came to Hilo for a beautiful, private, fantastic jungle hideaway, this is a great choice. you are literally in the middle of your own jungle oasis. this place has all the things you need to be comfortable and cozy while you watch the rain fall outside the huge picture windows. really remarkable
Great relaxing place to stay.

this place is magical just like the Big Isand it is on. I'm so grateful for the opportunityto stay here. The property is AMAZING!! There are many fruits growing, property is very neat and organized. I got a tour of the place and learned what the farm is all about. Dan and Rachel are geniuses in my book. I received so much Aloha from every person I met on the property.
Rachel responds to messages right away.
you have access to the most beautiful and private waterfall. I slept soundly to the symphony of rain forest sounds. No light pollution so I saw a sky full of stars on clear nights. You can hear the waterfalls from your room.
so many amenities: fresh coffee beans French press, kettle, thermos, coolers, umbrellas, bathroom toiletries etc.
I can go on and on. I'm home now and I can honestly say I miss the place. I hope to return again and again.

What an awesome experience! The cottage was just as described and the farm was even better! I didn’t have high expectations for the waterfall and I was overwhelmed with its beauty, just steps away from the front door. The shower has great pressure and was hot!The king bed was extremely comfortable and we fell asleep to the coqui frogs and woke up to birds chirping! We also sat outside at night in awe of the stars. Dan was kind enough to take us on a tour of the farm so we could learn how they live off of the land.
Highly recommend this place if you’re looking for something unique!

Absolutely wonderful. The setting is breathtaking, the cabin gorgeous, and Rachel was welcoming, engaging and very helpful. I can’t recommend this place enough - the whole experience was one which will stay with me for a lifetime. I took the tour, opted to get the fruit basket, and bought some items from the farm stand - all of these were well worth doing. Definitely don’t miss out on the chocolate which is handmade on the farm!
A one-of-kind Hawaiian forest experience.
This place was Great! It did not disappoint. The special care in details to make guests comfortable was exceptional. I would stay again and again. 10/10. Mahalo!

We just left this Airbn gem and can't wait to come back. If you love high rise, posh resorts, this wouldn't be for you. If you want to experience old Hawaii and rural countryside, this is it. I just hope that Rachel has availability when we come back! Thank you for a wonderful, peaceful stay.

This is an experience for someone who wants to see and feel nature in the midst of a place that is utterly unique. Like living in a jungle with fruits and flora you have never seen. A great diversion to the traditional beach scene and one that we will never forget!
Stayed three nights and wanted to stay three months. Rain and frogs and waterfalls. Everything you need and comfortable accomodations. Nothing like it.

This place is truly magical! The surrounding beauty that can be found at Forest Hale is what makes this Airbnb so special. The path down to the waterfall located a few steps from the front door is a once in a lifetime experience! Our Airbnb had all the amenities that we needed for a relaxing stay. Get the farm basket from Rachel and you’ll receive all the yummy foods needed for a nice breakfast. Make sure to explore the land at Forest Hale and stop by the farm stand to grab some yummy treats or beverages. Rachel responded easily and quickly to messages and was a great host. Thank you Rachel and Forest Hale for giving both of us an incredible visit on the Big Island.

Nice stay, very quite and relaxing area. Nice and cool as well so a/c needed. Check in was smooth and so was check out. The fruit stand is a nice plus as well and it’s in walking distance from the house. Had an issue with bugs but other than that great stay.

Beautiful healing sanctuary off the grid. Quiet, soothing & gorgeous with everything you may need for several days. The waterfall and emerald swimming pool is very special it feels secluded and private while being surrounded by lush greenery and protected by a tapestry of golden green striped bamboo. Magical.
Perfect!

Our family of four were very happy with our stay. The kids (4&6) enjoyed the loft and running around outside. It had everything we needed and there were no logistical issues (ie road, driving directions, drinking water, toilet and shower) that had caused me to hesitate when booking. Perhaps the highlight was driving down the road after arriving in the dark and seeing the ocean view!
Communication, location, comfort, amenities, etc were all immaculate! Would come back for sure

We loved staying at Rachel and Dan's place.
From the cottage they created to the waterfalls, through the small farm produce stand, everything was absolutely perfect and so authentic.
An unforgettable experience that we highly recommend.

Wonderful experience! We loved the jungle vibe. The home felt very secluded and swimming in the waterfall
pool was magical. We enjoyed the little market and diy breakfast too! Hilo was a super special place and it wasn’t a big deal to drive into town for restaurants and activities. Definitely a travel experience to remember!

This was a highlight of our vacation in Hawaii! The cottage ("Forest Hale") is surrounded by greenery and a short walk to a waterfall (maybe 20 ft high?)
Our kids loved seeing the animals on the farm and sleeping in the loft. They did not enjoy the fact that there was no TV, but still said it was their favorite place to stay in Hawaii and want to come back for longer next time.
Very clean and comfortable for our family of 4.
Short distance to larger waterfalls (Akaka falls), botanical gardens, and zip lines. Highly recommended.

The property exceeded our expectations. The waterfall was a special, magical place. Even bigger and more beautiful than the pictures. Dan and Rachel were terrific guests. The farm stand had amazing fruit, chocolate, yogurt, eggs, and wine! Highly recommend!
Rachel is a dream host, and the Hale is a fantasy stay. We have been in paradise. Our hearts will always remember this lovely location.
Beautiful waterfall and farm!

Rachel was a wonderful host. She was very responsive whenever I had a question. The place was wonderful. We enjoyed being out in nature, especially the beautiful waterfall. We had breakfast out on the patio many times enjoying the views. We also enjoyed the breakfast basket with new fruit for us to try. We would definitely come back!

This was the perfect end to our two week trip around Hawaii! My two girls loved learning about the farm from our host, the accommodations were very comfortable, the location was beautiful and close to plenty of things to explore and the farm stand was filled with tasty treats. We wouldn’t hesitate to return. Thank you for sharing your slice of paradise!
This was a wonderful place to stay! We loved the farm and the waterfall. They also make the most delicious chocolate!

This was the best family vacation we had! Rachel and Dan are very knowledgeable, hospitable and created a beautiful environment. We miss the home and the waterfall. It was nice to be surrounded by nature. Very serene and peaceful. Also we recommend taking the tour and buying local from the self serve food stand. Delicious!!!

Our stay was fantastic! Exactly as we had pictured it.
The cabin is clean, spacious, private, with all the amenities you may need.
Rachel is an excellent host. Great communication.
We had the farm breakfast basket both mornings which made our stay even more pleasant. The area is beautiful and peaceful. Great location on the hilo side- close to waterfalls and central between hilo and waipo valley.

This was a truly rainforest experience, with the frogs at night and a little rain. We enjoyed a tour of the farm ($45/couple). Rachel is a responsive, pleasant, and responsible host. We didn’t have any problems getting up to the property on the 1 lane road. Day trips to the falls and volcanos is a must. House is basic and comfortable enough, and matches the photos.

This was an amazing place to stay. It felt very secluded and private. The farm stand was a convenient way to get a few supplies to cook, and the diy breakfast was so generous, as we were able to try a variety of delicious local fruits. The cabin itself was very clean, spacious and had everything we needed. The instructions for everything was incredibly detailed and easy to follow. Communication with Rachel was easy, she answered any questions quickly and offered suggestions and insight to make things easier. The waterfall was a dream! We would love to return and next time do the farm tour. Overall it was probably my favorite Airbnb I’ve ever stayed in.

Rachel & Dan we’re great & quick communicators. We loved staying & can’t wait to come back! Dan provided a farm tour and we learned so much/enjoyed learning new things from him. The space is magic!! Everything was way above our expectations. EVERYTHING was perfect about this stay! Thank you for opening your space and sharing the land 🤍

This hale is a wonderful place to escape into nature! The waterfall is amazing, and so peaceful with the bamboo on the banks. I regret not swimming there more often. Because it's 30min from town, it gets very dark and you can see stars for miles during the night. For this same reason, I recommend you get there before sunset on your first night. The road going up is hilly and winding, but offers amazing views of the forest and ocean. As for the hale itself, the gigantic bed was so comfortable, I never wanted to get out! The entire place is very cozy, and Rachel provides all the cooking necessities and more. She and Dan are so very welcoming, and I felt the Aloha as soon as I got there. The gate opener is a must, especially on those rainy days.
The cabin right in the rain forest is so nice . Truly a connection with nature.

We had an incredible stay here! The place was clean, had all the amenities we needed and more, and was so comfortable. We loved going to the waterfall and swimming there, eating breakfast out on the front porch area, and visiting the farmstand everyday. The shower was also great - great pressure and temperature. We are already looking forward to coming back! Highly recommend!
I wish there was an option for more stars because I have never been so impressed with a place. It was WONDERFUL. Not a single complaint. Book it!! We already have plans to come back. ♥️♥️♥️

I stayed on the Farm with my husband and 9 year old son. It was such a wonderful place to stay. We loved the Farm tour, Farm Stand and breakfast baskets! Rachel was very easy to get a hold of and the house had everything we needed. Staying here made our trip to Hawaii even more special!

What a great experience! The beauty of the surrounding rainforest and farm, fresh fruits, room for the kids to play, and, of course, the waterfall. Many family memories were made here! Thank you, Rachel!
Lovely forest hale! We had a great time exploring the farm and swimming under the waterfall. The home was cozy and had everything you needed! Rachel and Dan are great hosts!
We absolutely loved our stay at Kulike Farm. The setting is remote and relaxing, and Rachel was welcoming and communicative before and during our stay.

It is amazing how much more you get from an AirBnB compared to a hotel of the same price. Rachel’s cabin is a hidden gem in a tropical paradise. She both gave us privacy and was attentive, via text, to ensure we were enjoying our stay. We spent most of our holiday time on the Kona side of the island but are super happy that we spent 3 nights at Rachel’s place near Hilo.
Our favorite part of our trip! We loved the cabin. It was beautiful, serene and everything we hoped for to end our vacation. Definitely recommend this stay!

We are a family of three, two adults and a 9 year old. The Forest Hale was a great base for exploring Hilo and surroundings, but it was also a lovely place to relax and enjoy the lush countryside. Rachel and Dan are fantastic hosts, warm and helpful but never intrusive. There’s a great self serve farm stand with fresh fruit, drinks, and baked goods on the property. Fresh eggs and greens are also available. Just a wonderful little spot, beautiful and exactly as described!

Beautiful house near gorgeous waterfall, pool, and river, spacious, light and clean. Kind hosts with quick responses via text. Personal guidance where needed. The bathroom was large and clean with a great shower and plenty of towels and hot water. The pictures are accurate. Kitchen supplied with basic equipment and condiments. We used fresh coffee beans and grinder daily. Especially nice refrigerator. Broiler worked fine as a toaster. Electricity was perfect for lighting and getting all our devices charged. Internet did great for streaming.

We really loved our stay here. They cabin is delightful, the farm and people are super interesting, the location and views are beautiful and swimming under the gorgeous on-site waterfall is the best start to your day. Stay here!

Amazing location with everything you need to have a wonderful getaway. Beautiful gardens and private cottage. We enjoyed a tour from Rachel and learned a lot about their farm. The location is also just a few minutes away from the Botanical Garden and zip lines.
Great place to stay. Nature all around. Frogs were a wonderful sound a night. A bit of a drive into Hilo.
Beautiful place! Would definitely want to stay here again!

Very enjoyable stay. Everything exactly as marketed. Very clean, have everything you need and more. Bed very comfortable. Access to washer dryer greatly appreciated. I would not hesitate to recommend this property fully!
Fantastic cabin in an idyllic setting. Very convenient to Hilo despite the remote feeling of the off grid experience. Delightful hosts!

Forest Hale was magical. For those who love peace and nature it is the perfect place. The cabin/ container is two-story and our little daughter loved her little empire under the roof. Communication with Rachel was flawless. The waterfall right next door was our private pool. Jumping into the fresh water was fantastic. We felt comfortable and safe.
It has a small farmer's stand right next to the accommodation. You can buy eggs, seasonal vegetables or fruits, and more.
The sounds of the frogs in the evening did not bother us.
It was 2 too short days. :-)
Forest Hale is a relaxing oasis.

Such a peaceful and tranquil spot, glad we had no plans to leave during our two night stay. Waterfall is spectacular to have literally right down a path from the house, fortunately we went down for a peek before it started raining as might be very slippery when wet. We took the farm tour and learned about new plants (ice cream tree was such a treat!) The place is set up with everything you might need, plus a lot of little extras Rachel has added to make your stay comfortable. The kitchen knives were actually sharp, this is incredibly rare in a rental.
We had a wonderful stay. Nothing like falling asleep to the sounds of the rainforest and getting off the grid for a few days. Will be back for another stay. Highly recommend!

The farm was amazing to stay at. The private waterfall was spectacular by itself. Rachel was an amazing host and did everything to make us feel comfortable. Her farm is outstanding and she has so much knowledge about the island and land! I wish I could have stayed in this bnb forever!
Great place, beautiful surroundings. perfect temperature for sleeping. no TV but the but the network is ample for steaming unless you just want to enjoy the beauty of the place.
Rachel is a wonderful host and we had a great time staying in the farm. It’s close to some of the most picturesque places and some great activities. Don’t miss the delicious treats in the farmstead.
Great rainforest stay

This is an enjoyable place in its own right... bright and lively decor, layout, and absolutely fantastic surroundings. But I also enjoyed having this eco-friendly place to stay in as a contrast to traditional hotels. No A/C (but yes attic fan), no TV, no dishwasher, but yes cool features like untreated water used in the toilet (that just flushes like normal, don't worry), recycle/ compost, walk to farmstand, and off grid power that made the lights twinkle sometimes. I LOVE how lightly this place allows you to tread on the Earth with just a little extra effort. It's still so fun and comfortable: awesome beds, great WiFi, hot shower, super close to Botanical World and its awesome zip line adventure (I told them where I was you're staying and they might give you a discount, but Rachel doesn't have like a coupon code) . Rachel and Dan give good guidance on how things work, and are there to support as needed. Dan also recommended a great beach (Richardson Ocean Park), and hooked us up with sand toys my kids used for digging and such there.
FYI, breakfast is not included. Happy to pay for the tour of the farm... such amazing work there!
We loved Rachel’s place, the songs of the birds at night, and the awesome breakfast

A wonderful farm stay that I wish was longer! Rachel was incredibly nice and helpful. We didn’t get a chance to tour the farm, but had we stayed longer, I would have loved that. The waterfall on the property is beautiful and a very short walk from the house. There was a charming farm stand there to pick up some local fruit (and natural bug spray). Overall a great stay that I’d recommend!

This is an amazing off-grid farm. If you’re looking for an off-grid experience and a peaceful stay, this place is a must! The location is relatively close to Hilo. Getting to the Forest Hale is easiest by mapping Kulike farm and follow Rachel’s turn-by-turn directions when you get to the gate. There is a cool waterfall just a short hike away from the cabin. You can swim there too. The sound of the coqui frogs will lull you to sleep while gazing at the stars through the huge window from your bed. After I left, I realize how much I miss the frogs. You can tour the farm and see first hand how permaculture farming works. Rachel and Dan are wonderful hosts. We bought some amazingly fresh eggs, apple bananas, homemade chocolate bars, and sugarcane lemonade from the farm stand. They take cash and Venmo. We would stay here again!

Rachel and Dan were quite kind in accommodating a very last minute change of plans due to unexpected travel changes I faced. I was grateful for their flexibility and willingness to go with the flow (and understanding of a separate length of stay mistake as well!). My interactions with Rachel were just what you’d expect from a super host. Her willingness to work with me, be so accommodating, and responsive was greatly appreciated. I hope to rebook so I get to enjoy the waterfall one day! Thank you Rachel.

My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Forest Hale! The house is very private so you can enjoy the big windows and leave them open to enjoy the fresh air (all have screens). We were very comfortable and took advantage of the chairs on the lanai to stargaze and even see several shooting stars. Highly recommend the farm tour early in your stay and that you take advantage of access to the waterfall and farm stand. We wished we had more time to just enjoy the waterfall and go swimming. The tour with Dan was easily a highlight of our trip. Easy access to Hilo and several local sights/activities. Rachel and Dan were very responsive and helpful as we planned our trip. Would definitely stay again!
A unique experience of a working farm and a magical waterfall!
Amazing stay! They have everything you need and the property is gorgeous! Make sure you plan to spend at least a few hours of daylight here, don’t want to miss swimming by the waterfall!

Beautiful, very clean home in the forest, only about 30 minutes from Hilo. The farm tour is incredible, it's really neat what they are doing and Rachel is very knowledgeable. The chocolate they produce on the farm is delicious. Internet access is very limited; don't plan on being able to work or stream information. Enjoy your time in the rainforest!

Private, spacious and cozy stay at Kukile Farm! Unique and impressive farm tour, including feeding chickens and tortoises and learning about natural farming. Delicious lemonade and fresh farm breakfast ingredients. The waterfall swim was a highlight. Lots of amenities and a restful stay.

Forest Hale is a beautiful space with plenty of room and a great view of the farm and sunrise. Rachel is a great host, gives detailed instructions for finding the place. The house manual is really detailed and informative. We enjoyed the farm tour and DIY breakfast. Would highly recommend and hope to return again.

Rachel and Dan's farm was the perfect place to escape the city life. It is about 20 to 30 min drive to Hilo, but it really is worth the extra drive if you are looking for a great experience. The farm itself was great. Rachel gave us a great tour and we learned a ton about the plants they grow and why. The kitchen had everything we needed to cook all our meals included different coffee options such as a french press and pour over coffee. The waterfall on the farm was also amazing! It is perfect for swimming in and is a very short walk. I am recommending this place to everyone I know that plans to visit the big island, or Hawaii in general!

Hale Kulike was a beautiful experience for us! We loved the unit, the rainforest, the farm stand. Rachel and Linda were so very kind and accommodating. We only hope that we will be able to return. An experience that won’t be forgotten!

Book this place! Rachel was a wonderful host, great with communication and very kind. She greeted us when we arrived and gave us a brief tour around the cabin. Being on the farm in the forest, listening to the frogs at night and hearing the rain in the evening and morning, it was magical. Some reviews said the frogs were really loud, I thought they were a nice muffled background noise (we had all the windows closed at night). We stayed in October, so it got chilly at night but the bedroom was always a little warmer than the rest of the cabin, for us it was the perfect temperature. I loved the peaceful mornings, drinking tea and looking out the windows. We got the breakfast basket - I highly recommend - and we loved getting chocolate and extra eggs from the farm stand. We got to swim in the private swimming hole with the falls! It was cold (of course!) and amazing and a highlight of our stay. There is no picture of the shower, but it's got a really nice and large shower head with decent pressure and the water stays hot! Everything was very clean and very comfortable. The bed was perfect. I'm a small person with chronic back pain, and I was a little worried it would be too firm from the reviews, but it wasn't. For me it was "soft but supportive." There's a magical mattress topper that, combined with the bed, made it the most comfortable AirBnb bed I've ever slept on. I woke up with no pain! There is a handy binder for guests and we took advantage of the 10% discount for Ziplining at the Botanical World Adventures just down the road, which was so much fun - just bring the little discount card to them. We rented a Jeep, which we were grateful to have for the farm roads. Location was perfect for exploring this side of the Island and going to Volcano National Park and the Summit. The wet side of the Big Island is definitely the best side! - beautiful lush green forests and waterfalls and plenty to see and do. The dry side is basically all volcano rock and resorts, though it does have nice beaches and interesting historical sites, but you can check that out to and from Kona airport. Stay with Rachel, you will love it!!

Rachel’s place is a true paradise and was exactly what I needed for a quiet few days away. The waterfall on site is epic and the location of her place is perfect to reach the beautiful sites of the Hamakua coast.
This is a must! If you are looking for something quiet and relaxing while having a kitchen to cook in and a private waterfall/swimming hole! We loved it here!

Just book it! Forest Hale is a little slice of paradise in a beautiful farm/jungle setting. Rachel and her team truly make it as comfortable as possible living off grid. The cabin is comfortable, beautiful views, sweet waterfall/swimming hole, farm stand is so convenient, the farm tour is amazing, and you’re only about 30 minutes (easy drive) from downtown Hilo. Miss it already and can honestly say this location made my trip that much more special.
Cute cabin in the jungle. Great amenities. Big, comfy bed. Short walk to private waterfall. Friendly hosts provided lovely tour of the farm.
The Forrest Hale is a perfect getaway.
Super beautiful location in the jungle! We loved swimming at the waterfall and the cabin was well equipped and comfortable.

Rachel’s place is a very cool off the grid experience. The farm was a huge plus. The kitchen is well equipped with everything you need. The hale is secluded and private. We had one clear day to explore the area and it was wonderful, the views, the rainforest….a very cool area of the island. If you looking for seclusion and to experience some serious rainforest, and don’t a lot of rain, Rachel’s place is the spot.
Wonderful place to stay. Private and beautiful with lots of thoughtful touches.

This is a must-do! The farm stand, the coqui frogs, the people (if you see any), the views (including the observatory)-everything was FANTASTIC. Be prepared for a true once-in-a-lifetime experience in nature…oh, and have a vehicle! Uber/Lyft won’t be an option here as we found out (still the best place we’ve stayed in awhile).
We enjoyed our stay on the farm, what a beautiful drive up and comfortable place to stay. Nicely located near Hilo.

Great place to stay. Quiet and feels like the perfect oasis. Perfect place to unwind and we loved having all the fresh fruit and other items available at the stand! We were able to see everything we wanted and more then come back to a calm space to relax at the end of the night.
This is a magical place! We loved visiting the waterfall, buying chocolate, and just relaxin. Definitely recommend!
Magical place. Our kids loved the forest and farm animals - ducks, chickens and even a tortoise! The house had everything we needed for a comfortable stay.

We had a very peaceful and serene experience at Rachel’s forest cabin. The location and the beautiful waterfall on the property makes it magical. Enjoyed the farm tour with Dan learning about their farming techniques and hydro electric project. Ideal place to unwind.

We had an amazing time at the property. Rachel and Dan are indeed super hosts, very responsive, friendly and accommodating. The place is clean, well equipped, located in such a beautiful area of the island, we thoroughly enjoyed the stay and hope to go back.
Very accommodating host, friendly, and such an amazingly beautiful place to stay!
Very cool cottage and had a great stay! So close to all the waterfalls for sight-seeing and kids loved sleeping in the loft.

Amazing. The area is lush with Greeks and fruits. Dan gives an incredible tour that is very informative and everything from the farm stand is delicious (especially the bread, sauerkraut and apple butter) I highly recommend staying here if your looking to truly experience all the island has to offer.

What a lovely home in such a unique location. I thought it would be difficult to get to, but it was much easier than I imagined. The forest house is beautiful - tucked away in the trees. It is clean and comfortable. The mattress on the bed was one of the best I’ve had in an Airbnb!
My daughters, age 9 and 14, enjoyed learning about all the plants you are cultivating on the land. Also thanks to Rachel who saved me a pile of money on zip lining, by sending me a copy of the coupon a month or so before our stay.

WOW! WHAT AN AIRBNB! We wanted a unique experience for it being our first time to Hawaii and we could not have asked for anything better. The house was comfortable and the views are spectacular. Plus a private waterfall?!? It was a little slice of beaver for us, thank you Rachel and Dan!

Very comfortable! Clean, efficient, eco-friendly farm stay but definitely not a “glamping” spot. So much more. The bed is firm and huge, which we enjoyed. The kitchen has everything you need - the coffee is a must try. The location is out there, not super close to much of anything and we liked that. Dan was so cool and informative to talk to. Our only regret was that it was torrential during our stay and we didn’t get to hang out in the waterfall area as it was moving very fast. Be aware that this can be a pretty wet area on the island - but it makes everything here beautiful!
Great

Loved our stay here! We loved the seclusion, getting massages above the falls, and the lovely fruit and eggs we received. Great location to still be accessible and, but super quiet and peaceful. The host was so friendly and easy to communicate with as well. Really special place, thank you!

The Forest Hale was a very peaceful, tranquil and beautiful stay. Rachel and Dan’s communication was fantastic whenever we needed something. During our extended stay we felt very comfortable with everything that the kitchen had to offer from pots and pans to sharpened cutlery. It’s obvious that they payed close attention to what folks will need during their stay..The waterfall was a nice way to cool down at any time of the day. We will echo other reviews and say, We highly recommend staying here for any period if time!
wonderful stay at this little slice of heaven.. if the country is your thing this place cannot be beat.
This place is absolutely wonderful. The waterfall is fantastic and refreshing. We will definitely book this place again next time we’re on the big island!

Everything was magical, especially the land. We enjoyed the peace and quiet, massages by the falls, our farm tour, and having dinners at the Hale. Thank you for everything. Everyone was so very friendly. Thank you for welcoming us!

Great spot to kick back and relax! The swimming hole and waterfall are wonderful and just a short walk away. Fresh eggs every morning and yummy chocolate from the farm stand. Lovely spot to sit out on the deck and read and take in the surroundings. Perfect for our family and striking distance to Hilo and hiking/beaches nearby. We would definitely return!
Such a wonderful space. The farm is beautiful and so is the waterfall. Definitely a real Hawaii experience. Wonderful hosts- we really couldn’t ask for anything better!

This was an exceptional stay. The house is located just far enough outside of Hilo that you can easily get to it by day and come relax with some amazing views by night. The walk to the waterfall was one of the highlights for sure. would highly recommend if you're looking to stay in the area and have a relaxing time.
Fully enjoyed our tour of the farm and peaceful setting. Thanks!

We loved our six days at Forest Hale!
This is exactly why we like staying at B&Bs.
A hotel in this kind of setting....well, does not exist, nor should it. The setting is everything, and its very important not to ruin it with too much of anything. And they've done it beautifully.
Be aware that the gathered fruit and eggs for the Breakfast Tray can be very special - you won't find some of this at the usual Fruit Stands in Hawaii, so you may get a chance to try some unique varieties, depending upon what's on the trees.
The Farm Tour is very worthwhile also, if you have any interest in the functioning farm up the hill from the Hale. You may be quite amazed, as we were, in all that interacts in a farm like this. Think "The Biggest Little Farm" movie - but smaller, and in Eden.
The amenities were fabulous, scenery was unbelievable, they were super kind and gracious hosts, and it was the best choice we could have made in terms of where we stayed on the island

We so enjoyed our stay at the Forest Hale! In retrospect, I wish we had booked 4 nights instead of 3, just so we would have had more time to take advantage of some downtime in the beautiful setting! Rachel was fantastic with communication from the start. The Hale was such a neat place. From enjoying our morning coffee on the lanai overlooking the property to the well stocked kitchen, we had everything we could have possibly needed to make it a comfortable stay. We especially loved purchasing items from the farmstand (especially the lilikoi butter and coconut chocolate chip cookies!). Those frogs at night are really something else! My husband can sleep through anything, but I was prepared with my earplugs, so sleeping was not an issue. The morning of check out, we did a tour of the farm with Rachel. It was fascinating to hear their story and see all that they’ve done to truly be living off the grid. This was definitely a one of a kind experience. We highly recommend Rachel and Dan’s Forest Hale!!

We absolutely loved our stay here. The house had everything we needed, the farm was so fun and interesting, and Rachel and Dan patiently answered all our questions about it! It truly felt like being nestled in our own little food forest. We loved the waterfall, ducks, eggs, fruit, and chocolate- not necessarily in that order...
It was also a great place to use as home base for all of the exploration we did of the Big Island.

We really enjoyed Rachel’s forest hale! It was very much off the beaten path, which we loved. The waterfall was beautiful and our kids liked walking the paths and checking out all the toads, fruit trees and geckos. Rachel was kind enough to let us purchase a local breakfast basket last minute with delicious tropical fruit and eggs. The house is a ways from a town so come prepared with your own food for dinner and breakfast, the kitchen has everything you need to make a good meal!

This is a one of a kind location! The space is clean, has exceptional touches and a generous layout given the size. Rachel and Dan are extremely gracious hosts and suck kind people. My kids loved it and have declared they can’t wait to go back.
The waterfall is wonderful and close enough to hear from the cabin. The cabin is secluded in a tropical forest, but when you emerge, the view is so wonderful! I would definitely stay here again!

Really enjoyed my stay! Location was super convenient to exploring Hilo and Volcanoes National Parks. The outdoor bathroom was such a unique and fun highlight, and the entire unit was clean, comfortable and had everything I needed.

Nice quiet place to stay, is relatively close to food / grocery stores. Will definitely need a car to get around if you're staying out here. The set up outside is great, very relaxing but the roof does leak by the toilet when it rains.

We loved staying at this little cabin! The outdoor shower made this stay more unique, and everything inside was pristine and exactly as described. We were surrounded by nature, which is a great stay if that’s what you’re looking for. Would stay here again if we’re ever in the area.

Calming getaway from the city with great food options a short drive away in Hilo and surrounding communities. Ideally located for visitors to the National Park. Toddler loved the space and even saw a frog and a mother hen with baby chicks! Outdoor baths were super peaceful and let you relax with the natural surroundings. Also would like to highlight that Hilo as a whole is wonderful for young families with the Imiloa Astronomy center and botanical gardens on the UH Hilo campus, plenty of playgrounds throughout the city, Japanese gardens, and even a free zoo and rainforest.

Loved the private outdoor bath, everything was exactly as described in the listing. Only thing I would caution is if this is your first time visiting Hawai'i and you're looking to do more touristy things, the location is not ideal for that since that's mainly on the other side of the island. However, if you're looking to stay fairly close to Volcano National Park and a lot of great hikes, than this is a great spot!

One of my favorite air bnbs ever! The bathroom outside was one of the most romantic things I’ve EVER done. The rain right next to the rainforest made the trip. The communication was great! Would stay here again if visiting this island!

I couldn’t recommend a more peaceful setting 💖 the other airbnb is family friendly but we didn’t notice until about 0830 the following morning. Remember to bring some bubble bath because you’ll easily spend most of your time in the bath listening to the frogs
We really enjoyed staying here. It was so relaxing and peaceful. We will definitely be back.
Amazing place, very serene and in a great location away from the hustle and bustle.

Melissa's and Morgan's place was wonderful. Morgan was a wonderful co-host and very quick to answer any questions. The place is beautiful and exactly as they describe it. I would highly recommend staying in this little tropical oasis.
I enjoyed my stay here and would stay again in the future. The location was private and not too far from Hilo. The outdoor shower/ tub was amazing.

This was an awesome space for my husband and I - just what we needed for a few days away from Honolulu. The location was a little away from town but peaceful, easy to find and not too far from the main highway. I loved the outdoor bath and soaking tubs - they were a really nice touch.

Melissa’s place was such a beautiful retreat. Of course the biggest feature was the tub area. It is very clean and in great condition. It was nice to listen to nature while taking a warm bath.
The bed was super comfortable and the place was clean. You’ll definitely need a car to get here but if you are looking for a private get away it’s amazing. I would love to come back here again and spend a few more days.
It was really lovely and peaceful :)
A nice quiet place to stay. Very relaxing!
Had a really relaxing weekend here, and loved the double outdoor tubs!
great place!
Lovely and well updated. My inlaws enjoyed their stay there on our trip.
Very nice stay near hilo! We loved soaking in the outdoor baths every night and loved that it was so central to Hilo and volcano. I definitely would stay here again!

Awesome Airbnb. Close to lots of restaurants in the area. Can access Hilo in about 30 min. We really loved the outdoor bathtubs/ showers that they have. They’re awesome after a full day of hiking. Place is clean and has microwave and a small kitchenette.
This Airbnb was the perfect place to rent! Gorgeous studio with amazing outside tubs and showers. Very peaceful with lots of nature sounds. Would 100% rent again!
great jungle stay. bed was comfy, loved the outdoor soaking tub. My favorite part! Great outdoor lighting. Jungle noises lulled me right to sleep.

What a gem! This place has all that is described and the outdoor tubs are such a unique feature. Spotless and well equipped. What a wonderful place! The hosts are very easy to deal with and put lots of extra little touches on the listing - local cookies and the bath bombs to name a few. Do not hesitate to book - you will not be disappointed! So peaceful and perfect.

We had a great stay at Melissa's place. She and her co-host were very responsive and helpful. Easy to find and get in, place was clean and exactly as pictured. The outdoor tubs were a great touch. Thanks so much!
great location, easy to get to and the outdoor bathroom tub for 2 is amazing! the kitchenette was suitable for us.
Lovely stay in this little studio. It's quite peaceful & quiet.

The outdoor bathroom was just what we needed after going to the green sand beach!! Easy check in, and the place was SUPER CLEAN. Also the coffee maker and coffee were a wonderful touch, and lovely bathbombs. It was a great place to relax and enjoy nature!

Melissa’s place has been a lovely and unique! place to stay; clean and nicely appointed. The location was central for our needs and felt private.
Melissa was responsive and attentive of our requests, and all household needs were in place.
The outdoor shower area was much more than that, making a beautiful extension of the cottage.

The outdoor bath was such a highlight! so nice to take a bath or use the toilet while out in nature during the day and at night, it was magical! My husband and I slept great, loved spending the day in Hilo or other surrounding areas and driving back to this place. There is a mini-fridge inside and a larger fridge/freezer right outside. Microwave, toaster oven, and electric skillet was perfect for our needs. Would definitely stay again!

My boyfriend and I stayed here for a few nights while on the big island and loved our time here. Melissa was very accommodating and her place was very clean not to mention the beautiful outdoor baths that were great after a day of exploring the island. Would definitely stay here again!

I frequently travel to Hawaii to visit my family. I have had the opportunity to explore all the islands, and I must say that this particular location provided a truly delightful environment for relaxation and tranquility. Should you find yourself in the vicinity of Hilo, I wholeheartedly endorse considering a stay at Melissa's establishment.
With sincere gratitude,
Melissa.
Very nice and cozy studio in a tropical environment. 10/10 experience.
Great clean place to stay, second outdoor bathroom was a nice touch, especially the tubs.
Amazing place to stay!!
Beautiful beautiful place, clean and organized, had the best time! Kitchen area is well equipped, outdoor bath tubs are simply amazing! Loved it!
Highly recommend.

This little space was beyond perfect!
It was recently updated and is so, so nice. Clean, comfortable and stocked with all the necessities- not to mention the sweetest little personalized welcome message! The patio baths were warm and very comfortable and the A/C was a blessing. Easy check in and out, pretty garden, and friendly chickens. A 30 minute drive to Hilo, it’s great for a peaceful stay. We would go back in a heartbeat!

It was amazing, the outdoor shower and bath were the highlights; the bed and pillows were super comfy and they provided such a perfect space to come home to at the end of the day. Melissa delivered the aloha experience!

Very nice apartment, spacious, new and clean. The terrace overlooks a very nice garden. Super quiet environment.
We'll be happy to go back!
cozy place close to downtown, the owner was quick to respond and provided a fan for the bedroom, which was a great deal to make the stay comfortable

Super great spot for a solo traveler but could also be wonderful for a couple on a shorter getaway. Aesthetically pleasing, well ventilated, awesome shower, great price. A fan of some type that could be set up by the bed would be a nice touch as well as some larger trash cans but these are small quibbles - if you book this place, I would fully expect that you will enjoy your stay.
Really lovely studio in Hilo! We enjoyed the back patio & the location was great for exploring the east side of the island.

Hosts were very informative and accommodating. Condo small but squeaky clean and well furnished. Ninth floor view. They anticipated our every need including quarters for the laundry! Unfortunately, flying termites hatched that night and they were everywhere. Hosts understood and issued a refund with no squabbling. They are super nice.
Big bed and AC! :) Thx from California!

Shae's place was perfect for our short visit to Hilo. Location was great in the center of town with a nice view. The bed was extremely comfortable, kitchen was well-stocked, and information guide was extremely helpful. Would highly recommend.

I can’t put into words how wonderful Shae was. She provided the best and descriptive recommendations and the condo was incredibly cute and had everything we needed and more. The views were incredible. We would highly recommend to anyone spending time in Hilo. Thanks Shae!

Wonderful is the word that covers it all. From location, to amenities, to great communication and overall ease.
This was an absolutely fantastic stay. What a great gem this place is ! And what calm and what a view from the balcony...
Very clean and very well stocked.
The bed was very comfy, and we appreciated all the extra (cafe, chocolate,shampoo, bathrobe, beach chairs, mask...: everything you might need will be there ! Mahalo Shae.
We 100% recommend staying here you will not regret it !
Shae was very responsive. Her comprehensive book of instructions was much appreciated. The kitchen was very complete. Will definitely consider a return visit. Thanks
Very comfy and cozy for our stay during our honeymoon stretch on the Big Island! Felt great to lay our heads after a long day of adventures!
Shae was great on communicating before, during and at the end of our stay. And we really enjoyed our coffee each morning on the lanai, such a peaceful and beautiful view. Mahalo!
Great experience.

This place had everything I needed and then some. I loved her little hand written notes around the apartment and little forgot something box, she’s thought of everything! The apartment had a great view and was super peaceful. Shae was an amazing host and super communicative. I’ll definitely be staying here again when I visit Hilo 🌺

I had a great stay at this AirBNB. As this was my first time ever using the app, it was an amazing experience. Shae was very responsive whenever I’d message her. Her home was very neat. I especially loved that she included things like toothbrushes, sunscreen, umbrellas, and etc. if needed.
Very nice condo and very responsive host. She attended to every detail to ensure our stay was comfortable.

Shae’s condo has been the best AirBNB we have ever stayed at! It was well stocked, extremely clean and well taken care of. The bed was very comfortable. It is in walking distance to a couple of local restaurants, and 5 minutes from pretty much anything in Hilo. Shae has all sorts of extras in case you forgot something. We even used the laundry room while we were there. The building leading up to the condo is older, but don’t let that deter you. The condo is great! I loved the kitchen.

Everything about the place was as described. Stunning views, ultra comfortable bed, dedicated outdoor parking spot, fully equipped kitchen and little extras. The hosts were exceptional, very thoughtful and provided detailed instructions for checking in and out as well as a welcome book. Highly recommend! We'll take wonderful memories of this place with us.

It was my boyfriend and my first time staying in Hilo. We enjoyed having some local treats for us when he checked in. Also Shae had left detailed notes throughout the condo for us and it was greatly appreciated. We loved sitting on the lanai looking out over the pond and relaxing. We explored a lot of the big island and Hilo town was by far our favorite for a local Hawaiian feel. I highly recommend taking the time to go to Green Sand beach while you are there! Thanks again Shae!

The condo is small but perfect for two people. Check-in and check-out instructions were easy. The view from both rooms is peaceful and absolutely beautiful. I spent quite a bit of time walking in the park next to the building, enjoying the lake, looking at the birds and taking in the scenery. Shae was always available to answer questions and provide help and recommendations. She very thoughtfully left instructions and tips on how to work appliances, provided wonderful bathrobes, and a list of things to do in and around Hilo. We look forward to returning in the future.

We can’t say enough about Shae’s condo! And about Shae! We found her place to be clean, so comfortable and very quiet. Sitting on the lanai with morning coffee or evening glass of wine was just the best! Beautiful sunrises and virw over the park. Shae responded immediately and was very proactive. When she heard we were planning to grill, she came right over with a brand new grill kit for us. And how often have you been to an Airbnb where they have beach chairs, snorkeling equipment, beach towels, suntan lotion… Everything you need! I’ve never have been at one that’s been this well equipped! Even provided quarters for the laundry. Shae, you and your place are exceptional! Thank you!

Shae's place was amazing.
I was happy while staying in a pleasant accommodation.
Thank you for your thoughtful consideration.
I only take good memories from Hilo.
Thanks again!

I have found my home away from. home in Hawii at Shae's. So centrally located peaceful and just beautiful location to the park the beach downtown! Condo exceeded our expectations stocked with everything you could need and more. Shae's place was the absolute business!.
💯💢💯💢💯💢💯💢💯💢💯💢
We had an absolutely wonderful experience at Shea's condo. She had several little extras in the condo. It was very clean and spacious with a nice balcony to enjoy the outdoors and views.
Fantastic apartment. Great host.
